title: Packing and Covering Triangles in K4-free Planar Graphs

lemmas.name: tuza_k4free_planar
lemmas.statement: theorem tuza_k4free_planar (G : SimpleGraph V) (hP : isPlanar G) (hK4 : isK4Free G) : 2 * triangleCoveringNumber G ≤ 3 * trianglePackingNumber G
implications: BETTER than Tuza for this class

lemmas.name: k4free_planar_tight_examples
lemmas.statement: Equality τ = (3/2)ν holds iff G is disjoint union of 5-wheels (plus non-triangle edges)

lemmas.name: tuza_edges_in_two_triangles
lemmas.statement: Same bound holds if each edge belongs to at most 2 triangles

k4free_tight.statement: For each ε > 0, exists K4-free G with τ(G) > (2-ε)ν(G)
k4free_tight.notes: Integer Tuza is tight even for K4-free

key_insight: K4-free planar graphs satisfy BETTER bound. But K4-free in general still approaches τ = 2ν.
implications_for_nu4: Need K4 or K5 for counterexample
notes: 5-wheel structure could be relevant for understanding extremal cases
